result.execSummary:
The defendant James R Strehlow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James R Strehlow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James R Strehlow was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BAIL APPLIED $745.00. Balance to be paid at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 5/01/2016; alternate 26 days jail.

BAIL APPLIED TO BLOOD COSTS AND DNA.
Blood costs to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept.

With Huber.
Release for work and treatment.
credit for 3 days.
COMMENCE TODAY

AS OF 3/04/2016: Court amends to allow transfer of Huber to Walworth County.
NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Defendant James R Strehlow in court with attorney Breanne Bucher for attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss count 2 in the criminal complaint.  Court dismisses count 2.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 4, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant to post $1000.000 cash and sign a $2500.00 signature bond.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.   Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.
